variantrule.name: Alternate Rule: Style Re-Training
entries: Certains styles de combat ont des usages spécifiques. Envisagez de permettre aux combattants de votre jeu de réentraîner leur style de combat au cours de quelques longues pauses, ou d'une seule longue pause s'ils sont de haut niveau, afin d'ajuster leur technique.

tools: one set of {@item artisan's tools|phb} of your choice.

default: (a) {@item chain mail|PHB} or (b) {@item leather armor|PHB}, a {@item longbow|PHB}, {@item Arrows (20)|PHB|20 arrows}
(a) {@filter martial weapon|items|source=phb|category=basic|type=martial weapon} and {@item shield|PHB} or (b) two {@filter martial weapons|items|source=phb|category=basic|type=martial weapon}
(a) {@item light crossbow|PHB} and {@item Crossbow Bolts (20)|PHB|20 bolts} or (b) two {@item handaxe|phb|handaxes}
(a) a {@item dungeoneer's pack|PHB} or (b) an {@item explorer's pack|PHB}

subclass.name: Master at Arms
subclassFeatures: Master at Arms|Alternate Fighter|LLAF|Master at Arms|LLAF|3
Master of Forms|Alternate Fighter|LLAF|Master at Arms|LLAF|7

classFeature.name: Fighting Style
entries: At 1st level, you learn one Fighting Style of your choice from the list at the end of this class description. You cannot learn a Fighting Style more than once, even if another feature allows you to learn an additional Fighting Style.

If a Fighting Style has prerequisites, like a skill proficiency or a minimum Ability Score or Fighter level, you can learn it at the same time that you meet all of its prerequisites. Each time you gain a Fighter level, you can replace a Fighting Style you know with another Fighting Style of your choice.
At certain levels, you learn more Fighting Styles, as shown in the Fighting Style column of the Fighter table above.

entries.name: Alternate Rule: Style Re-Training
entries: Certains styles de combat ont des usages spécifiques. Envisagez de permettre aux combattants de votre jeu de réentraîner leur style de combat au cours de quelques longues pauses, ou d'une seule longue pause s'ils sont de haut niveau, afin d'ajuster leur technique.

classFeature.name: Second Wind
entries: You can fight on where lesser warriors would fail. Also at 1st level, you can use your bonus action to regain hit points equal to 1d10 + your Fighter level. Once you do so, you must finish a short or long rest before you can do so again.
Upon reaching 14th level, you can use your Second Wind bonus action twice between each short or long rest.

classFeature.name: Martial Exploits
entries: Au 2e niveau, vous avez commencé à maîtriser des techniques uniques pour améliorer vos compétences martiales, tant sur le champ de bataille qu'en dehors.

entries.name: Exploits Known
entries: You know two {@filter Exploits|optionalfeatures|feature type=LL:ME} of your choice from the list at the end of this class. To learn an Exploit you must meet any prerequisites it has.
You learn additional {@filter Martial Exploits|optionalfeatures|feature type=LL:ME} of your choice as you gain levels in this class, as shown in the Exploits Known column.
Lastly, whenever you gain a Fighter level, you can replace one of the Martial Exploits you know with another Martial Exploit of your choice.

entries.name: Saving Throws
entries: If one of your Exploits requires a creature to make a saving throw, the Exploit saving throw DC is calculated based on your Strength or Dexterity. Once you choose which ability score to use, it cannot be changed:

classFeature.name: Exploit Dice
entries: The Fighter table shows the number of Exploit Dice you have to perform any Exploits you know. Most Exploits require you to expend Exploit Dice to use them. You can only use one Exploit per weapon attack, ability check, or saving throw, and you regain expended Exploit Dice when you finish a short or long rest.
Vos dés d'exploitation commencent par des {@dice d6}s, et augmentent au fur et à mesure que vous gagnez des niveaux dans cette classe, comme indiqué dans la table des combattants.
When adding an Exploit Die to a roll, always roll your Exploit Die and add it to the result.

classFeature.name: Eye for Talent
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you can evaluate the combat potential of creatures. As a bonus action, you can take the Search action, targeting a creature you can see within 30 feet (DC = 8 + its Challenge Rating). If you have hit this creature with a weapon attack, you add your Fighter level to your ability check.
If you succeed on the check, you learn one characteristic of your choice from below. If you fail, you cannot use this feature on that target again until you hit it with a weapon attack:

classFeature.name: Warrior Archetype
entries: At 3rd level, choose the Warrior Archetype from the options below that best represents your skills and training: Arcane Knight, Champion, Captain, Marksman, or Master at Arms.
Also included at the end of this class are Archetypes inspired by official options for Fighters: Sylvan Archer, Knight Errant, Shadowdancer, Ronin, and Runecarver.
Your Warrior Archetype grants you features at 3rd level and again at 7th, 10th, 15th, and 18th levels.

entries.name: Archetype Exploits
entries: Chaque archétype possède une liste d'exploits d'archétype que vous apprenez aux niveaux de combattant indiqués dans la description de votre archétype. Ils ne comptent pas dans le nombre total d'exploits connus et ne peuvent pas être remplacés par d'autres exploits. Si vous ne remplissez pas les conditions préalables d'un Exploit d'Archétype, vous l'apprenez quand même.

classFeature.name: Archetype Feature
entries: Au 7e niveau, vous gagnez une caractéristique accordée par votre archétype du guerrier.

classFeature.name: Archetype Feature
entries: Au 10e niveau, vous gagnez une caractéristique accordée par votre archétype du guerrier.

classFeature.name: Archetype Feature
entries: Au 15e niveau, vous gagnez une caractéristique accordée par votre archétype du guerrier.

classFeature.name: Archetype Feature
entries: Au 18e niveau, vous gagnez une caractéristique accordée par votre archétype du guerrier.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: Lorsque vous atteignez le 4ème niveau, vous pouvez augmenter un score de capacité de votre choix de 2, ou vous pouvez augmenter deux scores de capacité de votre choix de 1. Comme d'habitude, vous ne pouvez pas augmenter un score de capacité au-dessus de 20 en utilisant cette caractéristique.
Si votre DM autorise l'utilisation de feats, vous pouvez à la place prendre un {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: Lorsque vous atteignez le 8e niveau, vous pouvez augmenter un score de capacité de votre choix de 2, ou vous pouvez augmenter deux scores de capacité de votre choix de 1. Comme d'habitude, vous ne pouvez pas augmenter un score de capacité au-dessus de 20 en utilisant cette caractéristique.
Si votre DM autorise l'utilisation de feats, vous pouvez à la place prendre un {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: Lorsque vous atteignez le 12ème niveau, vous pouvez augmenter un score de capacité de votre choix de 2, ou vous pouvez augmenter deux scores de capacité de votre choix de 1. Comme d'habitude, vous ne pouvez pas augmenter un score de capacité au-dessus de 20 en utilisant cette caractéristique.
Si votre DM autorise l'utilisation de feats, vous pouvez à la place prendre un {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: Lorsque vous atteignez le 14ème niveau, vous pouvez augmenter un score de capacité de votre choix de 2, ou vous pouvez augmenter deux scores de capacité de votre choix de 1. Comme d'habitude, vous ne pouvez pas augmenter un score de capacité au-dessus de 20 en utilisant cette caractéristique.
Si votre DM autorise l'utilisation de feats, vous pouvez à la place prendre un {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: Lorsque vous atteignez le 16ème niveau, vous pouvez augmenter un score de capacité de votre choix de 2, ou vous pouvez augmenter deux scores de capacité de votre choix de 1. Comme d'habitude, vous ne pouvez pas augmenter un score de capacité au-dessus de 20 en utilisant cette caractéristique.
Si votre DM autorise l'utilisation de feats, vous pouvez à la place prendre un {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: Lorsque vous atteignez le 19ème niveau, vous pouvez augmenter un score de capacité de votre choix de 2, ou vous pouvez augmenter deux scores de capacité de votre choix de 1. Comme d'habitude, vous ne pouvez pas augmenter un score de capacité au-dessus de 20 en utilisant cette caractéristique.
Si votre DM autorise l'utilisation de feats, vous pouvez à la place prendre un {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Extra Attack (1)
entries: Beginning at 5th level, you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn. Moreover, if you use your action to Dash or to Disengage you can make one weapon attack as a bonus action on that turn.

Lorsque vous atteignez certains niveaux dans cette classe, le nombre d'attaques que vous pouvez effectuer dans le cadre de votre action d'attaque augmente ; au 11e niveau (3 attaques) et au 17e niveau (4 attaques).

classFeature.name: Extra Attack (2)
entries: Au 11e niveau, vous pouvez attaquer trois fois lorsque vous effectuez l'action {@action Attack} à votre tour.

classFeature.name: Extra Attack (3)
entries: Au 17e niveau, vous pouvez attaquer quatre fois lorsque vous effectuez l'action {@action Attack} à votre tour.

classFeature.name: Action Surge
entries: Starting at 6th level, you can push yourself past your limits, if only for a moment. Once during your turn, you can choose to take one additional action. After you do so, you must finish a short or long rest before you can use this feature again.
Lorsque vous atteignez le 20e niveau, vous pouvez utiliser cette caractéristique deux fois entre chaque repos court ou long, mais seulement une fois par tour.

classFeature.name: Indomitable (1)
entries: Votre esprit combatif vous permet de saisir le succès dans la gueule du loup. À partir du 9e niveau, lorsque vous ratez un jet de sauvegarde, vous pouvez choisir de le réussir à la place. Une fois que vous utilisez cette caractéristique, vous devez terminer un long repos avant de pouvoir l'utiliser à nouveau.

À certains niveaux de combattant, vous pouvez utiliser cette caractéristique plusieurs fois entre chaque repos long. Vous pouvez utiliser cette caractéristique deux fois à partir du 13e niveau, et trois fois à partir du 17e niveau.

classFeature.name: Martial Superiority
entries: The chaos and thrill of battle fuels you. Starting at 11th level, once per round in combat you can use one 1st or 2nd-degree Martial Exploit you know without expending an Exploit Die.

classFeature.name: Indomitable (2)
entries: Au 13ème niveau, vous pouvez utiliser Indomptable deux fois entre deux longs repos.

classFeature.name: Indomitable (3)
entries: Au 17e niveau, vous pouvez utiliser Indomptable trois fois entre deux longs repos.

classFeature.name: Relentless
entries: At 20th level, your combat skills are those of legend and myth. You regain all expended Exploit Dice when you roll initiative.
You can also use any 3rd-degree Martial Exploits you know any number of times between each short of long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Knight
entries: Les chevaliers des arcanes complètent leurs compétences en matière d'armes de guerre par des connaissances en arcanes. Comparés aux mages qui n'étudient que la magie, les chevaliers des arcanes ne peuvent produire que des sorts mineurs, mais, lorsqu'ils sont combinés à leurs compétences mortelles avec les armes de guerre, ces sorts mineurs deviennent de puissantes améliorations.

subclassFeature.name: Spellcasting
entries: Lorsque vous adoptez l'archétype du chevalier des arcanes au 3e niveau, vous apprenez à lancer des sorts d'arcanes mineurs, un peu comme un sorcier.

entries.name: Cantrips
entries: Vous apprenez deux cantrips de votre choix parmi les {@filter Arcane Knight spell list|spells|subclass=Alternate Fighter: Arcane Knight (LLAF)|level=0}. Vous apprenez un cantrip supplémentaire de chevalier des arcanes au 10e niveau.

entries.name: Spell Slots
entries: La table de lancements de sorts des chevaliers des arcanes indique le nombre d'emplacements de sorts dont vous disposez pour lancer vos sorts de 1er niveau et plus. Pour lancer l'un de ces sorts, vous devez dépenser un emplacement du niveau du sort ou d'un niveau supérieur. Vous récupérez tous les emplacements de sorts dépensés lorsque vous terminez un long repos. Par exemple, si vous connaissez le sort de 1er niveau {@spell shield} et que vous disposez d'un emplacement de 1er niveau et d'un emplacement de 2ème niveau, vous pouvez lancer {@spell shield} en utilisant l'un ou l'autre de ces emplacements.

entries.name: Spells Known of 1st-Level and Higher
entries: Vous en connaissez trois de 1er niveau {@filter Arcane Knight spells|spells|subclass=Alternate Fighter: Arcane Knight (LLAF)}.  La colonne Sorts connus de votre table de lanceur de sorts indique quand vous apprenez d'autres sorts de 1er niveau ou plus, d'un niveau pour lequel vous avez des emplacements de sorts.

Lorsque vous gagnez un niveau, vous pouvez remplacer l'un de vos sorts connus par un autre sort de la liste de sorts des chevaliers des arcanes. Le sort doit être d'un niveau pour lequel vous avez des emplacements de sorts.

entries.name: Spellcasting Ability
entries: L'Intelligence est votre capacité de lancement de sorts pour vos sorts de Chevalier des Arcanes. Vous utilisez l'Intelligence chaque fois qu'un sort fait référence à votre capacité de lanceur de sorts. Vous utilisez également votre modificateur d'Intelligence lorsque vous définissez le jet de sauvegarde DC ou effectuez un jet d'attaque pour un sort de Chevalier des Arcanes.

subclassFeature.name: Enchanted Armaments
entries: You magically bond yourself to your armaments of war. Over the course of 1-hour, which can be during a short or long rest, you can perform a ritual to bond with a weapon or shield that you are touching. You can have two such objects bound. If you perform this ritual again, you must release one object.

So long as they are on the same plane of existence as you, you can use your bonus action to conjure one or both objects, instantly donning them. You can use either of these objects as a spellcasting focus, and you cannot be disarmed of them.

subclassFeature.name: War Magic
entries: You can seamlessly weave minor spells with weapon attacks. When you use your action to cast an Arcane Knight spell you can make one weapon attack as a bonus action on that turn.

subclassFeature.name: Enchanted Strikes
entries: Your weapons are enchanted to undercut defenses against your spells. Whenever you hit a creature with an Enchanted Armament attack, the creature has disadvantage on the first saving throw you force it to make against one of your Arcane Knight spells before the end of your next turn.
Also, when you hit a target with an Enchanted Armament attack, you can change the damage type of your weapon to match the damage type of an Arcane Knight spell you know.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Surge
entries: Drawing upon your stamina triggers a burst of magic. Each time you use Action Surge, you can teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see. You can choose to teleport before or after the additional action from your Action Surge.

subclassFeature.name: Legendary Arcane Knight
entries: You expertly weave spell and sword together. When you take the Attack action on your turn, you can cast an Arcane Knight spell with a casting time of one action in place of one attack.
You can still use any Arcane Knight spells you know with a casting time of one attack (such as {@spell lightning lure (alternate)|llspell}) as normal.

subclassFeature.name: Champion
entries: Les champions renoncent à toute autre forme d'amélioration pour se concentrer sur l'amélioration de leur puissance physique brute. Ces immenses personnages s'efforcent de maintenir une condition physique optimale en s'entraînant sans relâche. Au combat, les champions réalisent des prouesses athlétiques surnaturelles et submergent leurs ennemis avec leur puissance brute.

subclassFeature.name: Champion Exploits
entries: Vous apprenez certains exploits aux niveaux de combattant indiqués dans le tableau ci-dessous. Ils ne sont pas comptabilisés dans votre nombre total d'exploits connus et ne peuvent pas être changés lorsque vous gagnez un niveau.

subclassFeature.name: Mighty Warrior
entries: The raw physical might you have cultivated enhances your attacks. Your weapon attacks score a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20 on the d20.
At 15th level, this critical hit range increases again and your weapon attacks score a critical hit on a d20 roll of 18 through 20 on the d20.

subclassFeature.name: Peak Athlete
entries: You are a paragon of athleticism. You gain proficiency in Athletics, and you gain a climbing speed and swimming speed equal to your walking speed.
If you were already proficient in Athletics, you gain proficiency in another Fighter class skill.

subclassFeature.name: Archetype Exploits
entries: You learn additional exploits for your archetype.

subclassFeature.name: Remarkable Strength
entries: Your physical abilities are unrivaled by normal mortals. When you make a Strength or Constitution ability check or saving throw, you can use {@optfeature feat of strength|LLExploits} or {@optfeature heroic fortitude|LLExploits} without expending an Exploit Die.
Used this way, {@optfeature feat of strength|LLExploits} counts as if you spent one Exploit Die, though you can add Exploit Dice to it.

subclassFeature.name: Archetype Exploits
entries: You learn additional exploits for your archetype.

subclassFeature.name: Devastating Critical
entries: Whenever you score a critical hit with a weapon attack you deal bonus damage equal to your Fighter level.
At 15th level, when you score a critical hit with a weapon attack, you can maximize the damage instead of rolling. Once you do you must finish a long rest before you can do so again.

subclassFeature.name: Legendary Champion
entries: You are a nearly perfect physical specimen and have become exceedingly hard to kill. If you begin your turn with less than half of your hit points remaining, but at least 1 hit point, you regain hit points equal to 5 + your Constitution modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Captain
entries: Not all fighters rely solely on themselves in battle, some use their deep knowledge of battlefield tactics to coordinate their allies. Captains are warriors who lead from the front of the battle, issuing orders and inspiring greatness in others by their own brave deeds. By their presence, a Captain can transform an unorganized militia into a deadly fighting force.

subclassFeature.name: Captain Exploits
entries: You learn certain Tactical Exploits from the Warlord Class at the Fighter levels noted in the table below. These Exploits do not count against your total number of Exploits Known:
Tactical Exploits from this feature use the following rules:

entries.name: Replacing these Exploits
entries: Each time you gain a level in this class, you can replace one Tactical Exploit you learned through this feature with another Tactical Exploit of the same degree. If a Tactical Exploit has a Warlord level prerequisite, you can learn it if your Fighter level meets that prerequisite.

entries.name: Leadership Modifier
entries: Some Tactical Exploits require a Leadership modifier. Choose your Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma as your Leadership modifier for these Exploits.

entries.name: Leadership save DC
entries: When you force a creature to make a saving throw to resist one of your Tactical Exploits, you use your Leadership modifier to calculate the Save DC:

subclassFeature.name: Archetype Exploits
entries: You learn additional exploits for your archetype.

subclassFeature.name: Archetype Exploits
entries: You learn additional exploits for your archetype.

subclassFeature.name: Student of War
entries: You have studied strategies of both politics and war. You gain proficiency in one of the following skills: Deception, History, Insight, or Persuasion.
Chaque fois que vous effectuez un test de capacité avec la compétence choisie, vous gagnez un bonus à votre jet égal à votre dé d'exploitation.

subclassFeature.name: Strategic Command
entries: Your determination in the face of danger inspires your allies to fight on. Whenever you use Second Wind, you can choose up to three other creatures within 30 feet of you who can see or hear you to also regain hit points equal to your Leadership modifier (minimum of 1) + your Exploit Die.

subclassFeature.name: Heroic Surge
entries: When you use Action Surge, you can choose another creature within 30 feet that can see or hear you. It can use its reaction to move up to its speed without provoking opportunity attacks and then make a single weapon attack.

subclassFeature.name: Inspiring Commands
entries: Once per turn when you use a Tactical Exploit that targets at least one friendly creature, one target of that Exploit gains temporary hit points equal to your Leadership modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Legendary Captain
entries: Your bravery and tactical ability rank you amongst the most successful military leaders of the age. At the end of a long rest, you can replace any number of your Captain Exploits with Tactical Exploits of the same degree.
Finally, whenever you use Heroic Surge, you can target up to two creatures within range.

subclassFeature.name: Marksman
entries: Alors que tous les combattants apprennent à tirer à l'arc ou à lancer un javelot, ceux qui s'entraînent comme tireurs d'élite se consacrent à la maîtrise des armes à distance de tous types. Souvent, leurs compétences mortelles s'accompagnent d'une arrogance et d'une confiance inébranlables. Grâce à ses talents innés et à son courage, un véritable tireur d'élite peut relever tous les défis.

entries.name: Gunpowder & Firearms
entries: Si votre jeu comprend des armes à feu et de la poudre à canon, et que votre tireur d'élite a été exposé au fonctionnement de ces armes, il est compétent en la matière.

subclassFeature.name: Marksman Exploits
entries: Vous apprenez certains exploits aux niveaux de combattant indiqués dans le tableau ci-dessous. Ils ne sont pas comptabilisés dans votre nombre total d'exploits connus et ne peuvent pas être changés lorsque vous gagnez un niveau.

subclassFeature.name: Archetype Exploits
entries: You learn additional exploits for your archetype.

subclassFeature.name: Archetype Exploits
entries: You learn additional exploits for your archetype.

subclassFeature.name: Elite Reflexes
entries: Your reaction times are enhanced by your talent and training. Whenever you are forced to make a Dexterity check or saving throw, you gain a bonus to your roll equal to your Exploit Die.

subclassFeature.name: Deadly Focus
entries: You can quiet your body to fire with deadly accuracy. When you begin your turn and are not surprised or incapacitated, you can choose to enter a state of Focus, which imposes the following benefits and effects until the end of your turn:

items: Votre vitesse est réduite à 0 pied.
Jusqu'à ce que vous touchiez une créature avec une attaque d'arme à distance, vous avez l'avantage sur tous les jets d'attaque d'arme à distance.

Lorsque vous obtenez un 1 ou un 2 sur un dé de dégâts pour une attaque que vous effectuez avec une arme à distance, vous pouvez relancer le dé. Vous devez utiliser ce nouveau jet, même si le nouveau jet est un 1 ou un 2.

subclassFeature.name: Quick Shot
entries: You react to danger without delay. You add your Proficiency Bonus to initiative rolls so long as you are not incapacitated.
Moreover, when you roll initiative and are not surprised, you can use your reaction to make one ranged weapon attack before any other creatures have a chance to act in combat.

subclassFeature.name: Tactical Reposition
entries: Your talents and training allow you to move about in battle to setup the perfect shot. Whenever you use your Second Wind, you gain the benefits of the Disengage action and your speed increases by 10 feet until the end of your current turn.

subclassFeature.name: Reliable Shot
entries: You make even impossible shots with ease. Your normal and long range for ranged weapon attacks increases by a number of feet equal to 10 times your Fighter level.
Also, once per turn when you have advantage on a ranged weapon attack, you can forgo your advantage to instead make one additional ranged weapon attack as part of that action.

subclassFeature.name: Legendary Marksman
entries: Your marksmanship rivals the great deities and demigods of the hunt. When you use Deadly Focus, your speed is reduced to 10 feet instead of 0, and you have advantage on all ranged weapon attack rolls while your Focus lasts.

subclassFeature.name: Master at Arms
entries: Alors que la plupart des combattants maîtrisent une discipline martiale spécifique, un maître d'armes est le rare guerrier capable de maîtriser véritablement plusieurs styles de combat. Que ce soit par la persévérance, le dévouement ou des compétences extraordinaires, ces combattants d'élite apprennent tout ce qu'ils peuvent sur la théorie du combat. Un maître d'armes est toujours à la recherche d'une nouvelle arme ou d'un nouveau style de combat à maîtriser.

entries.subclassFeature: Student of Battle|Alternate Fighter|LLAF|Master at Arms|LLAF|3|LLAF

subclassFeature.name: Student of Battle
entries: Your ability to learn and execute martial techniques exceeds that of most other warriors, and even other trained Fighters. You gain the following benefits to your Fighter features:

entries.name: Exploits
entries: You learn two 1st-degree Martial Exploits of your choice from the list at the end of this class. These Exploits do not count against your total number of Exploits Known.
You learn additional Martial Exploits following the same rules at certain levels: at 5th level you learn two 2nd-degree Exploits, and at 9th level you learn one 3rd-degree Exploit.

entries.name: Exploit Dice
entries: Your total number of Exploit Dice increases by 1, and all of your Exploit Dice increase to become d8s.
At certain Fighter levels your Exploit Dice increase again; at 5th level they are d10s, and at 11th level they are d12s.

subclassFeature.name: Advanced Technique
entries: Your ability to learn and execute combat styles exceeds that of most other warriors and even other trained Fighters. You learn an additional Fighting Style of your choice, but it does not count against your number of Fighting Styles Known.

subclassFeature.name: Combat Theorist
entries: You study the theory of combat as a sage studies their tomes. You gain proficiency in History, and whenever you make an Intelligence (History) check related to the history of combat, warfare, or armaments of war, you gain a bonus to your roll equal to your Exploit Die.

subclassFeature.name: Master of Forms
entries: Your skill allows you to learn exotic techniques from a variety of disciplines. You learn two Exploits of your choice from any class's Exploit list (see Advanced Martial Classes below).

If these Exploits have a level prerequisite, you can learn it so long as your Fighter level meets its level prerequisite. You must still meet all other prerequisites it might have. Exploits you learn with this feature don't count against your total number of Exploits Known.
You learn another Exploit of your choice following these same rules at 15th level and 18th level.

entries.name: Advanced Martial Classes
entries: {@i Master of Forms} références d'apprentissage des Exploits de n'importe quelle classe. Outre le combattant alternatif, il existe actuellement deux autres classes qui utilisent les exploits :

items: Le combattant alternatif : Expanded - {@book Found Here|LLAF:E|0|Alternate Fighter:Expanded}
Le barbare alternatif - {@link Found here|https://www.gmbinder.com/share/-N2gn3QXALCVqwAFJe5v}
Le Seigneur de la guerre - {@link Found here|https://www.gmbinder.com/share/-MrUNf61qoDb0Csw8a9r}

subclassFeature.name: Masterful Surge
entries: You channel the rush of battle to rejuvenate your technical skills. Whenever you use your Second Wind or Action Surge, you also regain one of your expended Exploit Dice.

subclassFeature.name: Warrior Savant
entries: Your knowledge of combat techniques allows you to modify your skill set. During each short or long rest, you can practice combat drills and replace one Exploit you know with another Martial Exploit you meet the prerequisites for. This cannot be used to replace or learn Exploits that add to an ability check.

subclassFeature.name: Legendary Superiority
entries: Your technical mastery of combat is near-supernatural. You regain one of your expended Exploit Dice at the start of each of your turns in combat, so long as you are not Incapacitated.

subclassFeature.name: Sylvan Archer
entries: Originally hailing from the elder forests of the world, Fighters who train to become Sylvan Archers learn to enchant arrows with ancient elven magics. Traditionally, these warriors serve as guardians of places of great natural power, but they have been known to train worth outsiders in their signature magic.

subclassFeature.name: Sylvan Lore
entries: You are learned in the Sylvan arts. You learn to speak, read, and write Sylvan, the ancient language of forests. You also gain proficiency in Nature. You can make Wisdom (Nature) check in place of the normal Intelligence (Nature) checks.
Finally, you learn the druidcraft cantrip, and Wisdom is your spellcasting modifier for it. When you cast druidcraft you can use a piece of ammunition as a spellcasting focus.

subclassFeature.name: Enchanted Arrows
entries: You have learned to enchant arrows and other ammunition with elder Sylvan magic. You gain the benefits listed below:

entries.name: Shots Known
entries: You learn two {@filter Enchanted Shots|optionalfeatures|feature type=LL:ASA} of your choice from the list at the end of this Archetype description. You learn one additional Enchanted Shot of your choice when you reach 7th, 10th, 15th and 18th level in this class.
When you gain a level in this class you can replace one of the Shots you know with another Shot of your choice.

entries.name: Enchanting a Shot
entries: Whenever you hit a creature with a ranged weapon attack, you can magically apply the effects of one Enchanted Shot you know as part of that attack.

You can use a number of Enchanted Shots equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 1). You regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest. If you have no uses left, you can expend an Exploit Die to use one of your Shots again.

entries.name: Saving Throws
entries: If one of your Enchanted Shots forces a creature to make a saving throw or an ability check, it makes its roll against your Exploit save DC.

subclassFeature.name: Sylvan Archer Exploits
entries: Vous apprenez certains exploits aux niveaux de combattant indiqués dans le tableau ci-dessous. Ils ne sont pas comptabilisés dans votre nombre total d'exploits connus et ne peuvent pas être changés lorsque vous gagnez un niveau.

subclassFeature.name: Archetype Exploits
entries: You learn additional exploits for your archetype.

subclassFeature.name: Sylvan Shot
entries: You weave minor amounts of magic into every shot you take. Your attacks with ranged weapons gain the benefits below:

items: They are magic for overcoming resistance and immunity.
If you miss, you can use a bonus action to curve the shot and repeat your attack against another target in range.
When a creature succeeds on a saving throw against an Enchanted Shot, it still takes half as much damage.

subclassFeature.name: Archetype Exploits
entries: You learn additional exploits for your archetype.

subclassFeature.name: Enchanted Quiver
entries: Whenever you make a ranged weapon attack you can conjure a piece of magical ammunition as part of the attack. After the attack, hit or miss, this ammunition vanishes.
Also, when you roll initiative, you regain one expended use of your Enchanted Shot feature.

subclassFeature.name: Legendary Sylvan Archer
entries: The power of your enchantments rivals that of the ancient elvish guardians. Whenever you use an Enchanted Shot it deals additional damage equal to your Exploit Die

Also, you can overload one of your Enchanted Shots with overwhelming magic. When you use an Enchanted Shot you can empower it, causing creatures of your choice within 20 feet of the target to also suffer the effects of the Shot.
Once you empower an Enchanted Shot this way you must finish a long rest before you can do so again.

subclassFeature.name: Knight Errant
entries: Often raised at court or in the upper circles of the nobility, the archetypal Knight Errant is a chivalric warrior of the highest order. They excel at mounted combat and wander the world in search of adventure and opportunities for heroism. These paragons of virtue are bound to defend the weak and weary.

subclassFeature.name: Knight Errant Exploits
entries: Vous apprenez certains exploits aux niveaux de combattant indiqués dans le tableau ci-dessous. Ils ne sont pas comptabilisés dans votre nombre total d'exploits connus et ne peuvent pas être changés lorsque vous gagnez un niveau.

subclassFeature.name: Archetype Exploits
entries: You learn additional exploits for your archetype.

subclassFeature.name: Archetype Exploits
entries: You learn additional exploits for your archetype.

subclassFeature.name: Chivalric Mark
entries: You punish any foe who attacks those under your protection. Once per turn when you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, you can Mark it until the end of your next turn. While Marked, it has disadvantage on attack rolls against targets other than you, so long as you are within 10 feet of it.

If your Mark deals damage to a creature other than you, you can use your reaction to make a melee weapon attack against it. As part of this reaction you can expend an Exploit Die to grant yourself advantage on the attack roll, and on hit, you deal bonus damage equal to one roll of your Exploit Die.

subclassFeature.name: Courtly Pedigree
entries: You have been tutored in the traditional skills of nobility and the chivalric virtues. You learn to speak, read, and write one additional language, and you gain proficiency in one of the following: Animal Handling, History, Insight, or Persuasion.

subclassFeature.name: Trained Knight
entries: You been trained to ride a saddle from birth. You cannot be knocked from a mount against your will, and you can mount or dismount a trained mount with 5 feet of movement.

subclassFeature.name: Noble Guardian
entries: You are a shield for the meek. When you or a creature within 5 feet of you is hit by an attack, you can use your reaction to interpose your melee weapon or shield, granting it a bonus to its Armor Class against that attack equal to your Exploit Die.
If the attack still hits, you can expend one Exploit Die and grant the target resistance to the damage of that attack.

subclassFeature.name: Unyielding Knight
entries: No one can threaten your allies while you stand. You apply a Chivalric Mark to any creature you hit with a melee weapon, and Marked creatures have disadvantage on attacks against creatures other than you while you are within 30 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Perilous Charge
entries: You run down your foes, mounted or on foot. Once per turn, when you move 10 feet in a straight line then hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, it must succeed on a Strength saving throw against your Exploit save DC or it takes bonus damage equal to your Exploit Die and is knocked prone. If you are mounted, it has disadvantage on its save.

subclassFeature.name: Legendary Knight Errant
entries: You will defend your allies against any foe. You gain a special reaction that you can take once during every turn, but you can only use this special reaction to make an opportunity attack, to attack a creature under Chivalric Mark, or to use Noble Guardian to shield yourself or another creature.

subclassFeature.name: Ronin
entries: Though they have been known by many names over the ages, Ronin are Fighters who have been expelled from the service of their original lord or land. Regardless of the reason, these highly skilled warriors now roam the wild seeking absolution through battle. With nothing left to lose, these warriors fight with a deadly ferocity and ruthless focus unlike any other.

subclassFeature.name: Ronin Exploits
entries: Vous apprenez certains exploits aux niveaux de combattant indiqués dans le tableau ci-dessous. Ils ne sont pas comptabilisés dans votre nombre total d'exploits connus et ne peuvent pas être changés lorsque vous gagnez un niveau.

subclassFeature.name: Archetype Exploits
entries: You learn additional exploits for your archetype.

subclassFeature.name: Archetype Exploits
entries: You learn additional exploits for your archetype.

subclassFeature.name: Exiled Courtier
entries: You were once an influential member of a noble court or an important advisor. You learn to speak, read, and write one additional language of your choice and gain proficiency in either History, Insight, Performance, or Persuasion.

subclassFeature.name: Unyielding Spirit
entries: You fight with the unrivaled focus and ruthless ferocity of a warrior with nothing left to lose. As a bonus action, you can focus yourself to gain advantage on all weapon attack rolls and ignore any levels of Exhaustion you have until the end of your current turn. When you use this bonus action you also gain temporary hit points equal to your Fighter level.
You can use this feature once between each short or long rest with no adverse effects. However, each additional time you use it, you suffer 1 level of Exhaustion at the of the turn.

subclassFeature.name: Lordly Bearing
entries: Your experience and former station shine through no matter how downtrodden you may become. Whenever you make an ability check with your skill gained from Exiled Courtier, you gain a bonus to your roll equal to one roll of your Exploit Die.
You also gain proficiency in Wisdom saving throws. If you are already proficient in Wisdom saving throws, you instead gain proficiency in Charisma or Intelligence saving throws.

subclassFeature.name: Unrelenting
entries: You are able to push through adversity that would defeat a lesser warrior. When you roll initiative with no uses of your Unyielding Spirit feature remaining, you regain one use.
Moreover, whenever you use your Second Wind feature, your current level of exhaustion, if any, is reduced by 1.

subclassFeature.name: Swift Strikes
entries: You rain blows down upon foes like raindrops in a storm. Once per turn when you have advantage on a weapon attack roll against a creature, you can forgo your advantage to make one additional weapon attack against that creature.

subclassFeature.name: Legendary Ronin
entries: Your battle focus is so absolute that you can avoid the grasp of death itself, if only for a short time. When you are reduced to 0 hit points, you can immediately take an extra turn.

During this extra turn, you remain at 0 hit points, and any damage you take causes you death saving throw failures as normal. At the end of this extra turn, you immediately fall to the ground unconscious with 0 hit points, and if you gained three death saving throw failures during that turn, you die.
Once you use this feature you must complete a long rest before you can use it again. If you have no uses left, you can expend a use of Action Surge to use this feature again.

subclassFeature.name: Shadowdancer
entries: The energies of the Shadowfell grant many strange and dark abilities to those who can wield them. The Fighters known as Shadowdancers learn to draw these sinister powers through themselves to create an exact copy of their bodies in combat.

subclassFeature.name: Shadowdancer Exploits
entries: Vous apprenez certains exploits aux niveaux de combattant indiqués dans le tableau ci-dessous. Ils ne sont pas comptabilisés dans votre nombre total d'exploits connus et ne peuvent pas être changés lorsque vous gagnez un niveau.

subclassFeature.name: Archetype Exploits
entries: You learn additional exploits for your archetype.

subclassFeature.name: Archetype Exploits
entries: You learn additional exploits for your archetype.

subclassFeature.name: Conjure Shade
entries: As a bonus action, you can draw on the umbral magic of the Shadowfell to conjure a {@creature Shade|LLAF} in an unoccupied space you can see within 15 feet. This {@creature Shade|LLAF} is a magical copy of you created from Shadows. It uses the Shade stat block below. Though it resembles you, it has no personality of its own.
In combat, your Shade uses the following rules:

entries.name: Combat
entries: The Shade shares your turn in combat, but it cannot act on its own. You can telepathically command it to move up to its speed on your turn, but it is destroyed if it is more then 30 feet away from you at the end of your turn.

entries.name: Attacking
entries: Whenever you take the Attack action, you can choose for each individual attack to originate from you, or a Shade. If it originates from your Shade, you make the attack as if you were in its space, with all of your normal benefits.

entries.name: Duration
entries: Your Shade lasts until it is destroyed, you use a bonus action to dismiss it, or you conjure another Shade.

subclassFeature.name: Dance of Shadows
entries: You and your Shade dance about in a blur of shadows. While your Shade is within 30 feet, you can use an action to switch places with it without provoking opportunity attacks.
At 7th level, you can make a single attack from either you or the Shade after you use this feature. At 15th level, you can use this feature with either your action or your bonus action.

subclassFeature.name: Transfer Consciousness
entries: As an action, you can expend one use of your Second Wind to transfer your consciousness into your Shade. For 10 minutes, your body is Unconscious as you sense and interact with the world through this Shade. For this duration, this Shade can move up to 1 mile from your body without being destroyed.
This effect ends if the Shade is destroyed or you use your action to end it. You then return to your body as normal.

subclassFeature.name: Dark Sacrifice
entries: When a creature within 10 feet of a Shade is hit by an attack, you can use a reaction to cause your Shade to intercept that attack, reducing the damage the creature would take by your Fighter level, but destroying your Shade in the process.

subclassFeature.name: Restorative Shadows
entries: You draw the power of your destroyed Shades back into you. When one of your Shades is destroyed by taking damage, you can gain temporary hit points equal to twice your Exploit Die.

subclassFeature.name: Legendary Shadowdancer
entries: Your command over the Shadow Magic you use is unrivaled. Whenever you conjure a Shade, you can choose to conjure two Shades, without expending any additional resources.

subclassFeature.name: Runecarver
entries: Before the mortal races rose to power, the world was ruled by giants and their powerful Rune magic. Traces of this ancient magic can still be found in the wild and remote places of the world, and Fighters who learn to use the power of Runes to augment combat ability become known as Runecarvers.

subclassFeature.name: Rune Carving
entries: You have learned the ancient art of carving {@filter Runes|optionalfeatures|feature type=LL:RNA}. You learn to speak, read, and write Giant, the language of your Runes, and you gain proficiency with mason's tools. Your knowledge of Runes also grants you the benefits below:

entries.name: Runes Known
entries: You learn two {@filter Runes|optionalfeatures|feature type=LL:RNA} of your choice from the list at the end of this Archetype. Some Runes have a Fighter level prerequisite, which you can learn as soon as you reach that Fighter level. You learn one additional Rune of your choice when you reach 7th, 10th, 15th, and 18th level in this class.
When you gain a level in this class you can replace one of the Runes you know with another Rune of your choice.

entries.name: Inscribing a Rune
entries: Over the course of 1 hour, which can be during a short or long rest, you can use your calligrapher's supplies to inscribe a Rune you know into a weapon, suit of armor, or another object you can wear or hold. While wearing or wielding that object you gain the benefits of that Rune.
Each Rune can only be inscribed in one object. Inscribing it into another object dispels any previous inscriptions.

entries.name: Invoking a Rune
entries: While you are wearing or wielding an object inscribed with a Rune you can invoke its effect. Once invoked, a Rune cannot be invoked again until you complete a short or long rest. Only you can invoke your Runes.

entries.name: Runic Exploits
entries: Exploits learned from Runes don't count against the wielder's Exploits Known, use your Exploit Die, and can be used at will without expending an Exploit Die.

entries.name: Saving Throws
entries: If a Rune requires a creature to make a saving throw, it does so against your Exploit save DC.

subclassFeature.name: Runic Might
entries: As a bonus action, you can empower your body with Runic Might, granting you the following benefits for 1 minute:

items: You and anything you are wearing grows to become Large in size, so long as there is room.
You have advantage on all Strength ability checks and saving throws.
Once per turn when you hit a target with a melee weapon attack you gain a bonus to your damage roll equal to your Exploit Die.

entries: This feature ends early if you use a bonus action to revert to your normal size, or if you are incapacitated.
You can use this feature once per long rest. When you have no uses of this feature left, you can expend one use of your Second Wind to use Runic Might again.

subclassFeature.name: Runic Ward
entries: You can shield your allies with the stalwart magic of Runes. When a target you can see within 30 feet is hit by an attack, you can use your reaction to add your Constitution modifier (minimum of +1) to its Armor Class against that attack.
You can use this reaction a number of times equal to your Constitution modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.
If you have no uses left, you can Invoke one of your Runes to use this feature again in place of the Rune's normal effect.

subclassFeature.name: Unyielding Fortitude
entries: Your body has been fortified by the elder magic you wield. You have advantage on saving throw to resist being moved against your will, Poisoned, Stunned, or knocked prone.

subclassFeature.name: Elder Insight
entries: Your understanding of the ancient magic of Runes has grown deeper. When you have no uses of a Rune remaining you can expend one Exploit Die to Invoke that Rune again.
You can only Invoke each Rune you know one additional time in between each short or long rest in this way.

subclassFeature.name: Legendary Runecarver
entries: You can draw upon the elder power of your Runes to match the stature of the ancient giants. When you use Runic Might, you can grow to become Huge in size, so long is there is room. While you are Huge, your reach increases by 5 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Crusader
entries: Many warriors swear Oaths to gods of battle and war, but not all are blessed with the divine power of Paladins or Clerics. Those who fight for the gods without their explicit blessing are called Crusaders. These zealots are champions of divine causes, their fervent belief fueling their battle fury.

subclassFeature.name: Crusader Exploits
entries: Vous apprenez certains exploits aux niveaux de combattant indiqués dans le tableau ci-dessous. Ils ne sont pas comptabilisés dans votre nombre total d'exploits connus et ne peuvent pas être changés lorsque vous gagnez un niveau.

subclassFeature.name: Archetype Exploits
entries: You learn additional exploits for your archetype.

subclassFeature.name: Archetype Exploits
entries: You learn additional exploits for your archetype.

subclassFeature.name: Crusader's Ire
entries: Vous marquez vos ennemis pour le jugement divin. Comme une action bonus, vous pouvez marquer une créature dans les 60 pieds comme la cible de votre Crusader's Ire, vous accordant les avantages suivants :

items: Une fois par tour, lorsque vous ratez la créature avec une attaque d'arme, vous pouvez immédiatement effectuer une autre attaque d'arme contre cette créature en utilisant la même arme.

Lorsque la créature est à votre portée et qu'elle lance un sort ou effectue une attaque contre une créature autre que vous, vous pouvez utiliser votre réaction pour effectuer une attaque d'opportunité.
Lorsque la créature vous oblige à effectuer un jet de sauvegarde, vous gagnez un bonus à votre jet égal à votre dé d'exploitation.

entries: Votre marque dure 1 minute, ou jusqu'à ce que la créature soit tuée. Une fois que vous avez utilisé cette caractéristique, vous devez terminer un long repos avant de pouvoir l'utiliser à nouveau. Lorsqu'il ne vous reste plus d'utilisations, vous pouvez dépenser un dé d'exploitation pour utiliser à nouveau cette caractéristique.

subclassFeature.name: Fanatical Disciple
entries: You gain proficiency in Religion, and whenever you make an Intelligence (Religion) check related to your god or cause, you gain a bonus to your roll equal to one roll of your Exploit Die.

subclassFeature.name: Renewed Fervor
entries: Votre fanatisme vous donne des bouffées de ferveur au combat. Lorsque vous utilisez Second souffle, vous récupérez l'utilisation de Crusader's Ire.

De plus, lorsque vous marquez une créature comme cible de votre Ire du croisé, vous pouvez vous déplacer jusqu'à 30 pieds vers elle dans le cadre de la même action bonus sans dépenser votre mouvement.

subclassFeature.name: Zealous Fury
entries: Votre conviction vous permet de survivre à des coups qui tueraient des personnes de moindre foi. Lorsque vous êtes réduit à 0 point de vie mais que vous n'êtes pas carrément tué, vous pouvez tomber à 1 point de vie à la place, et effectuer immédiatement une attaque d'arme contre votre attaquant.

Une fois que vous utilisez cette caractéristique, vous devez terminer un repos court ou long avant de pouvoir l'utiliser à nouveau. Si vous n'avez plus d'utilisations, vous pouvez l'utiliser à nouveau, mais vous gagnez instantanément un niveau de {@condition exhaustion}.

subclassFeature.name: Righteous Judgment
entries: Vous êtes l'arbitre de la colère divine. Lorsque vous touchez la cible de Crusader's Ire avec une attaque d'arme, vous pouvez terminer la marque pour que votre attaque inflige les dégâts maximums au lieu de faire un jet.
Si l'attaque réduit la cible à 0 point de vie, vous récupérez instantanément l'utilisation de Crusader's Ire.

subclassFeature.name: Legendary Crusader
entries: Lorsque la cible de Crusader's Ire vous vise avec une attaque, vous pouvez utiliser votre réaction pour effectuer une attaque d'arme unique contre cette créature. Si vous utilisez cette réaction après que l'attaque vous ait touché, votre attaque d'arme est effectuée avec avantage.

subclassFeature.name: Guardian
entries: Les gardiens sont des guerriers d'élite défensifs dont les forces brillent lorsqu'ils combattent aux côtés de leurs alliés. Bien qu'ils soient entraînés à utiliser des armes de tous types, les Gardiens sont particulièrement efficaces lorsqu'ils utilisent un style de combat protecteur avec une arme et un bouclier. Seul, un Gardien est une petite menace, mais lorsqu'il combat aux côtés de ses alliés, il devient un mur d'acier impénétrable.

subclassFeature.name: Guardian Exploits
entries: Vous apprenez certains exploits aux niveaux de combattant indiqués dans le tableau ci-dessous. Ils ne sont pas comptabilisés dans votre nombre total d'exploits connus et ne peuvent pas être changés lorsque vous gagnez un niveau.

subclassFeature.name: Archetype Exploits
entries: You learn additional exploits for your archetype.

subclassFeature.name: Archetype Exploits
entries: You learn additional exploits for your archetype.

subclassFeature.name: Warrior Smith
entries: You have learned to keep your armor in peak condition. You gain proficiency in smith's tools. Whenever you make an ability check that uses smith's tools you gain a bonus to your roll equal to your Exploit Die.

Also, during the course of a long rest, you can spend 1 hour using your smith's tools to improve one set of armor or a shield you touch. It grants its user +1 bonus to Armor Class until the beginning of your next long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Iron Guardian
entries: You have trained to defend others, no matter the personal cost. You gain one of the following Fighting Styles of your choice: {@optfeature Defensive Fighting|LLExploits}, {@optfeature Protection|LLExploits}, or {@optfeature Shield Warrior|LLExploits}. It doesn't count against your number of Fighting Styles, and can only be replaced by a Style from the list above.

Also, if you are wielding a shield and a creature within 5 feet of you it hit by an attack, you can use reposition as a reaction. You can choose to do so without expending an Exploit Die, but no temporary hit points are gained.
When you use this reaction, you only take the damage of the triggering attack if it would have also hit you.

subclassFeature.name: Inspiring Sentinel
entries: 7th-level Guardian Archetype feature You presence inspires others to stand their ground. When you use Second Wind, creatures of your choice within 5 feet of you gain temporary hit points equal to 1d6 + your Constitution modifier (minimum of 1).
Moreover, when you use your Iron Guardian reaction, {@optfeature reposition|LLExploits} grants temporary hit points even if you do not expend an Exploit Die as part of the reaction.

subclassFeature.name: Stalwart Defender
entries: You are strongest when standing alongside your allies. The range of your Iron Guardian reaction now includes creatures within 10 feet, so long as there is a clear path for you to move to that creature. This reaction also does not end {@optfeature defensive stance|LLExploits} or {@optfeature hold the line|LLExploits} for you.

subclassFeature.name: Adamant Guardian
entries: You improve your defensive technique to better defend your allies. The range of your Iron Guardian reaction increases to include creatures you can see within 15 feet, so long as there is a clear path for you to move to the creature.
You are also no longer limited to using {@optfeature daring rescue|LLExploits} once between each short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Legendary Guardian
entries: You are a legendary shield for those who fight beside you. You gain a special reaction that you can take once per turn, but it can only be used for Iron Guardian, your Guardian Exploits, or opportunity attacks.

subclassFeature.name: Guerrilla
entries: Quelle que soit la mission, un guérillero l'exécutera avec la plus grande perfection. Parfois appelés commandos, ces guerriers sont marqués par leur détermination et leur capacité d'adaptation. Qu'il s'agisse d'un terrain accidenté, de monstres vicieux, de soldats ennemis ou de puissants lanceurs de sorts, rien, si ce n'est la mort, ne fera vaciller la volonté d'un guerrier de la Guerrilla dans la poursuite de ses objectifs.

subclassFeature.name: Adaptable Combatant
entries: You have honed your skills to meet any challenge. You gain proficiency in Athletics, Perception, Stealth, or Survival. If you choose a skill you are proficient in, you instead gain a bonus to checks with that skill equal to your Exploit Die.

Moreover, during the course of a long rest, you can spend 1 hour performing combat drills and practicing techniques. At the end of this hour, you can replace any number of your current Exploits Known with other Martial Exploits of your choice, so long as you meet the new Exploit prerequisites.

subclassFeature.name: Guerrilla Exploits
entries: Vous apprenez certains exploits aux niveaux de combattant indiqués dans le tableau ci-dessous. Ils ne sont pas comptabilisés dans votre nombre total d'exploits connus et ne peuvent pas être changés lorsque vous gagnez un niveau, ou en utilisant votre caractéristique Exploits adaptables.

subclassFeature.name: Archetype Exploits
entries: You learn additional exploits for your archetype.

subclassFeature.name: Archetype Exploits
entries: You learn additional exploits for your archetype.

subclassFeature.name: Survivalist
entries: You are an expert at overcoming natural obstacles. You learn either the Mariner or Mountaineer Fighting Style, but it does not count against your total number of Fighting Styles.

subclassFeature.name: By Land or Sea
entries: You have trained to find success in any environment, either it be land, sea, or sky. You gain the benefits listed below:

items: At the end of each long rest you can change switch your Fighting Style from Survivalist for the other option.
You can hold your breath for up to 1 hour.
You ignore the effects of nonmagical difficult terrain.
Whenever you use your Second Wind you also gain the benefits of the Dash action or the {@optfeature mighty leap|LLExploits} Exploit.

subclassFeature.name: Identify Weakness
entries: You pinpoint your enemy's weaknesses and ruthlessly punish them. When you succeed on an Eye for Talent check against a creature you can forgo the normal knowledge you would gain, and instead, the next time you force it to make a saving throw against one of your Exploits it does so with disadvantage.

subclassFeature.name: Unwavering
entries: You are remarkably hardy, even amongst elite warriors. Each time you use Second Wind you regain the maximum amount of hit points and you regain one expended Exploit Die.
You can also expend your Action Surge to instantly replace one of your Exploits with another Exploit you could learn.

subclassFeature.name: Legendary Guerrilla
entries: There is nothing that will stand between you and your goals when they are within your reach. When you roll initiative and are not surprised, you gain one of the following benefits:

items: You gain temporary hit points equal to your Fighter level.
You can take the Search action to use Eye for Talent.
You can immediately move up to your full speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

subclassFeature.name: Hound Master
entries: Depuis l'aube de la civilisation, les bêtes ont travaillé aux côtés des mortels. Le plus remarquable de ces animaux domestiqués est le chien. Les premiers chasseurs travaillaient en tandem avec ces fidèles bêtes, partageant nourriture et feu. Certains chasseurs reprennent encore ce flambeau et s'entraînent {@creature Loyal Hound|LLAF:E|Loyal Hounds} à l'aventure à leurs côtés.

entries.name: Loyal Hounds & Other Canines
entries: En fonction de votre table et de votre cadre de jeu, de nombreuses créatures peuvent être un chien fidèle.
Dans un cadre plus banal ou peu magique, votre molosse sera très probablement un chien ou un loup.
Dans d'autres jeux plus fantastiques, n'importe quelle bête à quatre pattes ou monstruosité peut servir de chien de garde.

subclassFeature.name: Hound Master Exploits
entries: Vous apprenez certains exploits aux niveaux de combattant indiqués dans le tableau ci-dessous. Ils ne sont pas comptabilisés dans votre nombre total d'exploits connus et ne peuvent pas être changés lorsque vous gagnez un niveau.

subclassFeature.name: Archetype Exploits
entries: You learn additional exploits for your archetype.

subclassFeature.name: Archetype Exploits
entries: You learn additional exploits for your archetype.

subclassFeature.name: Loyal Hound
entries: When you adopt this Archetype, you complete the training of a {@creature Loyal Hound|LLAF:E}. Your Hound is friendly to you and your allies and obeys your commands. It uses the Loyal Hound stat block, which uses your Proficiency Bonus (PB) and Exploit save DC. Your Loyal Hound uses the following rules:

entries.name: Combat
entries: In combat, your Hound acts during your turn. It can move and use its reaction on its own, but it only takes the Dodge action unless you use a bonus action to order it to take an action from its stat block, or to take another action. Also, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn, you can forgo one attack to order your Hound to make a single Bite attack.
If you are Incapacitated, your Hound can act on its own and will defend you and itself to the best of its abilities.

entries.name: Dying
entries: If your Hound is reduced to 0 hit points, it makes death saving throws like a player character would. When the Hound is at 0 hit points, you can use an action to touch it and expend one Exploit Die to automatically stabilize it.

entries.name: Training a New Hound
entries: If your Hound dies, you can spend 8 hours training a replacement for your Loyal Hound, so long as a suitably canine-type creature can be found. Once trained, the creature uses the Loyal Hound stat block.

subclassFeature.name: Iron Jaws
entries: Your Loyal Hound is infused with a portion of your fighting spirit. The damgae of your Hound's Bite attack is considered to be magical for overcoming resistances and immunities.

subclassFeature.name: War Hound
entries: You train your Hound to use basic combat maneuvers. Over the course of 1 hour, which can be during a short or long rest, you teach your Loyal Hound one 1st-degree Exploit you know that it could reasonably use. It gains one Exploit Die equal to yours which it can expend to use its Exploits, and it regains all Exploit Dice after a short or long rest.
Your Loyal Hound can be trained to use two Exploits, but you can use this feature to replace one of its current Martial Exploits with another Exploit following the same guidelines.

subclassFeature.name: Steadfast Companion
entries: You can face any foe so long as your Hound is by your side. While you and your Loyal Hound are within 30 feet of each other you both gain a special reaction which you can use to grant the other advantage on a saving throw.

subclassFeature.name: Canine Fury
entries: Once per turn when you order your Loyal Hound to make a Bite attack, it can make two Bite attacks instead of one.
In addition, you can use War Hound to teach your Loyal Hound 2nd-degree Exploits, it can be trained to use up to three Exploits, and it gains a second Exploit Die.

subclassFeature.name: Hound of Legend
entries: Infused by mythic power of your bond, your Hound rivals the great beasts of legend and myth. Your Loyal Hound uses the {@creature Hound of Legend|LLAF:E} stat block in place of its previous stats.
Finally, when your Loyal Hound is slain, it reforms after 1 hour, appearing in an unoccupied space within 15 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Mystic
entries: Where most Fighters look to increase their physical abilities, those known as Mystics work to unlock the psionic potential of their mind. Drawing upon wondrous inner power, these ascetic warriors can perform feats that would be impossible through strength alone. Where others strive for physical victory in battle, Mystics strive for spiritual enlightenment.

entries.name: Unleash your Psionic Potential
entries: The Mystic Archetype presented here is a replacement for the Psi Knight publshed in Tasha's Cauldron of Everything. As the Eldritch Knight is to the wizard, so the Mystic Knight it to the {@link Psion|https://www.gmbinder.com/share/-MPkCSxSj0OETiEd3Pyf}.

subclassFeature.name: Psionics
entries: Vous avez débloqué le véritable potentiel de votre esprit et avez appris à manifester des sorts, comme le fait un vrai {@link psion|https://www.gmbinder.com/share/-MPkCSxSj0OETiEd3Pyf}.

entries.name: Psi Points
entries: The potential of your mind is represented by a pool of Psi Points. The Mystic Psionics table shows how many Psi Points you have to manifest your spells of 1st-level and higher. To manifest a spell, you expend Psi Points equal to the spell's level (0 for Cantrips). You regain all expended Psi Points when you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: Mental Limit
entries: Your Fighter level limits the potency of spells you can manifest with your psionics. This is shown in the Mental Limit column of the Mystic Psionics Table.

entries.name: Spells Known of 1st-Level and Higher
entries: You learn two 1st-level spells of your choice from the Mystic spell list on the following page. The Spells Known column of the Mystic Psionics table shows when you learn more Mystic spells of 1st-level and up, but they cannot exceed your Mental Limit level.
Whenever you gain a Fighter level, you can pick one of the Psion spells that you know and replace it with another Psion spell of your choice, of a level equal to your Mental Limit or lower.

entries.name: Spellcasting Focus
entries: Your mind is your spellcasting focus for your Psion spells. You must have a free hand to cast spells with somatic or material components, and you must provide material components consumed by the spell or with a required gold cost. When you manifest a spell with Psionics, you exhibit noticeable changes.

entries.name: Spellcasting Ability
entries: Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for your Psion spells. You use Intelligence whenever a spell refers to your spellcasting ability. You also use your Intelligence modifier when setting the saving throw DC or making a spell attack roll for a Psion spell you know.

subclassFeature.name: Psionic Talents
entries: Your training has begun to unlock minor psionic abilities. You unlock two Mystic Talents of your choice from those available to the Psion Class. If a Talent has a prerequisite Psion level, you can learn it if your Fighter level meets that prerequisite.
You unlock an additional Mystic Talent of your choice when you reach 7th, 15th, and 18th level in this class.
If you learn a spell through a Mystic Talent, it is as a Mystic spell for you, using Intelligence as

subclassFeature.name: Phase Step
entries: When you use Second Wind, you also gain the benefits of the Dash action and partially discorporate. Until the end of your current turn, you can move through solid nonmagical objects and creatures as if they were difficult terrain.
If you end your movement inside an object or creature, you are instantly shunted to the nearest unoccupied space, taking 1d10 force damage for every 5 feet you are forced to move.

subclassFeature.name: Inscrutable Mind
entries: Your psionic abilities make you difficult for others to control. You gain resistance to psychic damage, and whenever you are forced to make an Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma saving throw you gain a bonus to the roll equal to your Exploit Die.

subclassFeature.name: Mental Ward
entries: You can project psionic power to shield others. As a bonus action, you can spend 5 Psi Points to project a psionic ward out to a 30-foot radius. For 1 minute, creatures of your choice in this area gain the benefits of Inscrutable Mind.

subclassFeature.name: Legendary Mystic
entries: You have unlocked the full potential of your mind. You learn the {@spell telekinesis} spell, but it does not count against your number of Mystic Spells Known.
You can manifest the {@spell telekinesis} spell once between each long rest, without expending any Psi Points. After that, you can epend 5 Psi Points to manifest it again.
Finally, whenever you use Phase Step, you also gain a flying speed equal to your walking speed until the end of your current turn. If, you end your turn flying you fall.

subclassFeature.name: Quartermaster
entries: Tout aventurier qui réussit connaît la valeur du travail d'équipe, mais aucun ne l'apprécie autant que ceux que l'on appelle les quartiers-maîtres. Ces guerriers solidaires s'efforcent d'aider leurs alliés à atteindre leur plein potentiel. Faisant constamment passer les besoins de leurs compagnons avant les leurs, les quartiers-maîtres maintiennent leur équipe en pleine forme avec une nouvelle ration et un coup de main.

subclassFeature.name: Down to Earth
entries: Vous gagnez une compétence avec {@item cook's utensils|PHB}, {@filter land vehicles|items|type=!treasure;!renaissance;vehicle (land);!modern;!futuristic}, et en {@skill Animal Handling}. Chaque fois que vous effectuez un test de capacité qui utilise l'une des compétences acquises grâce à cette caractéristique, vous bénéficiez d'un bonus à votre jet égal à votre dé d'exploitation.

subclassFeature.name: Quartermaster Exploits
entries: Vous apprenez certains exploits aux niveaux de combattant indiqués dans le tableau ci-dessous. Ils ne sont pas comptabilisés dans votre nombre total d'exploits connus et ne peuvent pas être changés lorsque vous gagnez un niveau.

subclassFeature.name: Archetype Exploits
entries: You learn additional exploits for your archetype.

subclassFeature.name: Archetype Exploits
entries: You learn additional exploits for your archetype.

subclassFeature.name: Rations
entries: You have learned to prepare potent the foodstuffs known as {@filter Rations|optionalfeatures|feature type=LL:QMR} which keep your allies in peak condition. Rations use the rules below:

entries.name: Preparing Rations
entries: During the course of each long rest, you can spend 1 hour with cook's utensils and prepare a number of Rations up to your Constitution modifier choosing from the list of Rations on the following page. If a Ration has a Fighter level prerequisite, you can prepare that Ration as soon as you meet its prerequisite.
The Rations you prepare lose all beneficial properties at the end of your next long rest.

entries.name: Consuming Rations
entries: While holding a Ration, a creature can use a bonus action to eat it or feed it to a creature within 5 feet. Consuming a Ration instantly grants you its benefits, and immediately ends any other Ration benefits.

entries.name: On the Fly
entries: As an action, you can expend one Exploit Die and use a set of cook's utensils to prepare one Ration of your choice. However, you cannot regain the Exploit Die you spent to prepare this Ration until that Ration is consumed.

subclassFeature.name: Dependable Ally
entries: You are always prepared to lend a helping hand to a comrade. When you take the Attack action, you can forgo any number of attacks to use one of the following in place of an attack:

items: Take the Help action targeting a creature within 10 feet.
Take the Use an Object action to feed a Ration, potion, or another consumable item to a creature you can touch.
Make an ability check using a Down to Earth proficiency.
Give one weapon, item, or shield to a creature you can touch. It instantly equips that item and stows one item.

subclassFeature.name: Quick Ration
entries: You have greatly improved the speed at which you prepare Rations. You can use a bonus action on your turn to create a Ration On the Fly, eating it or feeding it to a creature within 5 feet as part of the same bonus action. Rations you prepare in this way lose all beneficial properties after 1 minute.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Constitution modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Ever Ready
entries: You always have something ready to serve. When you roll initiative and are not surprised, you prepare one Ration of your choice without expending an Exploit Die.

subclassFeature.name: Legendary Quartermaster
entries: Constant culinary experiments with your Rations have made your body supernaturally hardy. Your Constitution score, and maximum Constitution score, both increase by 2, and you are immune to the Poisoned condition.
You can also be under the effects of two Rations at once. If you eat a third Ration, you chose which Ration effect ends.

subclassFeature.name: Swordsage
entries: Swordsage, maître des lames, saints des épées ; les guerriers experts qui consacrent leur vie à l'art du combat ont porté de nombreux noms au cours de l'histoire. Ne sortant son arme que lorsqu'il est prêt à tuer, un Swordsage ne tue une autre créature qu'en cas de nécessité. Un maître épéiste ne prend qu'un seul apprenti et enseigne tout ce qu'il sait à un seul guerrier.

subclassFeature.name: Student of the Blade
entries: Your training has granted you skills to compliment swordplay. You gain proficiency in either Acrobatics or Performance, and you can use your Dexterity, in place of Charisma, for Performance checks that incorporate a sword.
Also, when you make a Dexterity (Acrobatics) or a Dexterity (Performance) check you gain a bonus to your roll equal to your Exploit Die.

subclassFeature.name: Swordsage Exploits
entries: Vous apprenez certains exploits aux niveaux de combattant indiqués dans le tableau ci-dessous. Ils ne sont pas comptabilisés dans votre nombre total d'exploits connus et ne peuvent pas être changés lorsque vous gagnez un niveau.

subclassFeature.name: Archetype Exploits
entries: You learn additional exploits for your archetype.

subclassFeature.name: Archetype Exploits
entries: You learn additional exploits for your archetype.

subclassFeature.name: Battle Trance
entries: You can clear your mind to enter the mystical trance that gives Swordsages their reputation. So long as you are not wearing heavy armor or a shield, you can use your bonus action to enter a Battle Trance. This Trance lasts for up to 1 minute and grants you the following benefits:

items: You have advantage on Dexterity (Acrobatics) checks.
You can take the Dash action as a bonus action.
Vous gagnez un bonus de +1 à votre classe d'armure.
Once per turn, you can use a Swordsage Exploit without expending an Exploit Die. If it requires an Exploit Die roll, you use a d4 in place of your Die.

entries: Your Battle Trance ends early if you are Incapacitated, if you don a shield or heavy armor, or if you end it with a bonus action. You can enter a Battle Trance once per short or long rest at no cost, after which you must expend an Exploit Die to use this feature again.

subclassFeature.name: Mythic Reflexes
entries: Your reflexes have been honed mythic levels in pursuit of perfection. You gain Proficiency in Dexterity saving throws, and you add your Proficiency Bonus to initiative rolls.
Also, your Battle Trance AC bonus becomes +2.

subclassFeature.name: Reactive Trance
entries: You slip into the Trance at a moments notice. When you roll initiative and are not surprised or Incapacitated, you can enter your Battle Trance without expending a use.

subclassFeature.name: Storm of Steel
entries: You are a blur of flashing steel when you enter your Trance. Whenever you take the Dash action in the Battle Trance you also gain the benefits of the Disengage action for that turn.
In addition, whenever you roll Exploit Dice for an Exploit or another ability while you are in your Battle Trance, you can roll those Dice twice and choose which total to use.

subclassFeature.name: Legendary Swordsage
entries: You have become a Swordsage worthy of your own legends. You can enter and dismiss your Battle Trance at will, without expending a use of the feature or an Exploit Die.
Finally, whenever you take damage while you are in your Battle Trance, you can expend an Exploit Die to reduce any damage you would take by twice your Exploit Die.

subclassFeature.name: Tinker
entries: The fighters known as Tinkers seek an unorthodox form of martial skill. Rather than master martial techniques they look to augment their physical ability with mechanical inventions and innovative weaponry. Though they spend most of their time theorizing, tinkering, and experimenting with new Schematics, Tinkers and their inventive arsenals are a force to be reckoned with on the field of battle.

entries.name: Tinker's Knight in Your Setting
entries: Tinkers value brains over brawn. While the descriptive text here describes gears and springs, they can just as easily create their inventions with wood, rocks, crystals, bones, sticks, and scales.

subclassFeature.name: Analytical Mind
entries: You have spent as much time in workshops as you have at the training ground. You gain proficiency with tinker's and smith's tools. If you are already proficient with these tools, you gain proficiency with a set of tools of your choice.
Whenever you make an ability check that uses these tools, you gain a bonus to your roll equal to your Exploit die.

subclassFeature.name: Inventive Arsenal
entries: You have developed a cacophony of wondrous modifications for your weapons, shields, and armor, known as {@filter Schematics|optionalfeatures|feature type=LL:TKS}. All Schematics you know use the following rules:

entries.name: Schematics Known
entries: You know two {@filter Schematics|optionalfeatures|feature type=LL:TKS} from the list at the end of this Archetype. Some Schematics have a Fighter level prerequisite, and you can learn them at the same time that you meet that prerequisite Fighter level.
You learn one additional Schematic of your choice when you reach 7th, 10th, 15th, and 18th level in this class.
When you gain a level, you can replace one Schematic you know with another Schematic of your choice.

entries.name: Modifying an Object
entries: During each long rest, you can spend 1 hour using tinker's or smith's tools to touch a number of objects equal to the number of Schematics you know, modifying each object with the effects of one Schematic. An object can only bear one modification.

In order to modify an object it must meet the requirements in that Schematic's description. Schematic modifications last until the end of your next long rest, at which point the objects return to normal unless you modify them again.
Only you gain the benefits from these modifications, to any other creature, the objects function as normal objects.

entries.name: Saving Throw
entries: Si un schéma nécessite un jet de sauvegarde, votre DC de sauvegarde du schéma est calculé comme suit :

subclassFeature.name: Increased Function
entries: The workings of your inventions are more intuitive to others. If you spent 10 minutes teaching a creature, it can wield the special benefits of any item modified by your Schematics.
Moreover, objects modified by your Schematics count as magic for overcoming resistances and immunities, and you can modify magic weapons and armor with Schematics.

subclassFeature.name: Inventive Synergy
entries: The intricacies of your inventions work together and improve upon one another. You can modify an object with two of your Schematics so long as the object being modified meets the prerequisites of both Schematics in question.

subclassFeature.name: Flexible Innovation
entries: Your inventive arsenal can be adjusted on the fly to meet the challenges at hand. During the course of a short rest, you can use tinker's or smith's tools to transfer one of your Schematic modifications from one object to another that also meets the prerequisites of that Schematic.
If the Schematic modifies an object so that it has Charges, the number of remaining Charges is transferred to the object.
In addition, you can modify an object three Schematics, so long as it meets the prerequisites for all three Schematics.

subclassFeature.name: Legendary Inventions
entries: A weapon modified by your Schematics gain a +1 bonus to its attack and damage rolls for each Schematic applied to it, and any set of armor modified by a Schematic gains a +1 bonus to its Armor Class for each of your Schematics applied to it.
